text: <http://vimeo.com/103554797>

attachments.title: A Brief Look at Texting and the Internet in Film
attachments.text:
Is there a better way of showing a text message in a film? How about the internet? Even though we’re well into the digital age, film is still ineffective at depicting the world we live in. Maybe the solution lies not in content, but in form.

For educational purposes only. You can follow me at <http://twitter.com/tonyszhou|twitter.com/tonyszhou>

Here are three short films that take place on your desktop
Internet Story (2010): <http://youtu.be/g-SL4ejpP94|youtu.be/g-SL4ejpP94>
Noah (2013): <http://vimeo.com/81257262|vimeo.com/81257262>
Transformers: the Premake (2014): <http://youtu.be/dD3K1eWXI54|youtu.be/dD3K1eWXI54>

Music:
Trent Reznor & Atticus Ross - In Motion (from The Social Network)
David Arnold & Michael Price - On the Move (from Sherlock)
Daft Punk - End of Line (from Tron: Legacy)
Al Hirt - Green Hornet Theme (from Kill Bill Vol. 1)

text: Sherlock and House of Cards get it right.
I was just about to mention HoC

Not sure which channel this would fall under, but I am really impressed by this method of display. I've seen similar things using acrylic printing, but nothing really this striking. <http://www.eyalgever.com/Nuclear-Bomb>
<http://feltron.com/FAR13.html>
Wow!
nice

text: And looks like he doesn't work at FB anymore. Good for him.
<@U026PHQ3J|evans> has joined the channel
<!channel> Anyone having issues with creative cloud? I keep getting a "membership expired" popup and can't open Illustrator.
mine's working fine
I'm fine too
Crap
Time to pay up gaston
:weary:
have you ever turned off the "call home" making a less-than-legal upgrade
i had a pirated version of after effects when i installed CC, and it always thought i was in trial mode.
Ha. The things is that I'm using one from our account so I don't know if something broke on my end or on their end.
That is how most versions of Flash seemed to work when I was in school. CC has rather neatly prevented that.
i used the CC online chat help and it was actually pretty great
he un-did all my illegal shit
I have another Adobe question: anyone else using CC 2014 programs and find them taking FOREVER to finish launching?
hm, no
My Illustrator 2014 sometimes takes up to 6 minutes to open
how old is your computer?
and how much memory do you have
It's David's old macbook
8GB
Photoshop CC takes literally 10 seconds
i'm not using Photoshop 2014 because I cant' figure out how to transfer my workstation groups or whatever
workstation groups?
i LOVE Photoshop cc2014. it has totally changed my workflow
workspace
Like "Essentials" "Typography" and custom work views right?
hm, i've nevereven used that workspace feature
I had to totally reset those on 2014
yeah. if mine is even a little different i freak out
It's actually screwed me up for kind of a while now
Can't remember how I used to have it.
and now i feel stupid for not just re-doing what i have in CC
but no, it should open just as quickly as CC
Didn't Adobe brag about how good this upgrade was for migrating preferences and such?
Yeah, maybe it's the computer I'm using.
Oh well.
are you maxed out on memory?
yeah...if its affecting your ability to work, it may be time for a new machine
I don't think it's maxing out memory. And it's only been recently.
Didn't used to be that way
ah, i meant can you go to 16?
somewhere on the apple site there is a way to check
Ah, got it.
totally depends on the year / model
Yeah
It's likely a processor, not ram problem. Or your hard drive could be slowing down.
that it's so focused around one app leads me to think it's something with that app rather than the machine
if everything else is performing normally, I'd suspect something's messed up with Illustrator
It's an old machine for sure. Other things are slow-ish but this particular instance is pretty extreme
have you tried removing it and reinstalling it?
Not yet. I've just been waiting for it to finish and then I forget about it until I have to wait next time.
Hm, just tried starting it up again and only took 1:30.
Had to reboot earlier because of other things freaking out, maybe it was all I needed?
Funny it gets better only just after I bring it up
<@U0260V1BX>: i'm switching over to photoshop 2014, what should I check out?
so
smart objects are the shit now
you can have layer comps within smart objects
wha wha what?
so you can specify what state you want to display
so for instance if you have a website nav, you can use different instances of the same smart objects to show different on states
and you can share smart objects across multiple files
and you'll notice that when you hold down the command key you can measure distances between objects really easily
and you can finally control and adjust rounded corners, although its still a little finicky
<http://helpx.adobe.com/photoshop/using/whats-new.html>
